pull.title: Added Bootstrapping Tutorial
pull.body:
Blockchain download is the biggest annoyance we have, added one of my
tutorials for bootstrapping.

events.message:
Added Bootstrapping Tutorial

Blockchain download is the biggest annoyances we have, added one of my
tutorials for bootstrapping.

events.body: @super3 The Bitcoin Foundation does not officially or unofficially offer the torrent.  That's all me, in my spare time.
@jgarzik Where does the Bitcoin Foundation come into this PR at all? I don't see @super3 suggesting they endorse anything...
Ok, that has been fixed. Let me know if there is anything else.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/1b61d988987f9197ff2fb321c1dbf0a246ea349e for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@ Copyright (c) 2009-2013 Bitcoin Developers
 
 Setup
 ---------------------
-[Bitcoin Core](http://bitcoin.org/en/download) is the original Bitcoin client and it builds the backbone of the network. However, it downloads and stores the entire history of Bitcoin transactions (which is currently several GBs); depending on the speed of your computer and network connection, the synchronization process can take anywhere from a few hours to a day or more. Thankfully you only have to do this once. If you would like the process to go faster you can [download the blockchain directly](https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=145386.0).
+[Bitcoin Core](http://bitcoin.org/en/download) is the original Bitcoin client and it builds the backbone of the network. However, it downloads and stores the entire history of Bitcoin transactions (which is currently several GBs); depending on the speed of your computer and network connection, the synchronization process can take anywhere from a few hours to a day or more. Thankfully you only have to do this once. If you would like the process to go faster you can [download the blockchain directly](http://armoryguide.com/bootstrapping-the-blockchain/).
comments.body: It would be best to include this guide in the Bitcoin tree instead of referring to an external site. Not that this is worse than referring people to the bitcointalk forums.
